page.title: 07Thomas Bolton and Johnson
page.content: Boltons is a big copper firm in Froghall on 32 acres in the narrow Churnet valley. There used to be copper deposits in the valley; now they use scrap copper and imported copper from Canada and Zaire. They use gas to melt the copper. Formerly coal which came in canal boats was used. 750 people work there and 90% of the workers live nearby, in the Cheadle district. There are 150 managers and clerks, 40 foremen, 160 skilled workers and 400 production workers. Men usually work 39 hours a week, earning about three pounds an hour. Boltons make copper pipes for water supply and central heating; wire (including some special wire used in body scanners); strips, bars and castings. The products are sent all over Britain by Bolton's own lorries, and to India and North America.
